summary: The bill, titled the Strengthening VA Patient Advocacy for Rural Veterans Act of 2025, aims to improve the Department of Veterans Affairs' Office of Patient Advocacy. It mandates the designation of patient advocate coordinators for rural and highly-rural veterans receiving care outside of VA medical centers. It also requires that patient advocates report to the medical center director and mandates an annual report to Congress, detailing data from the Patient Advocate Tracking System, including common issues, resolution times, and feedback.
